sampling_site_description: Subcutaneous tissue beneath the leg's skin sample.
Adipose tissue on the large fold of parietal peritoneum that hangs down from the greater curvature of the stomach, passing in front of the small intestines.
Left, followed by the right if necessary for sufficient aliquots.
Ascending aorta or other thoracic regions (nonatherosclerotic).
Left and right, noncalcific regions only.
Left Tibial. Peripheral tibial artery from gastrocnemius region
Central posterior urinary bladder, trimming from the outer wall if necessary.
Amygdala (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Anterior cingulate cortex (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Caudate (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Cerebellar hemisphere (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Right cerebellum (sampled at donor collection site and preserved in PAXgene fixative).

Right cerebral frontal pole cortex (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Hippocampus (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Hypothalamus (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Nucleus accumbens basal ganglia (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Putamen basal ganglia (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Spinal cord (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Substantia nigra (sampled at Miami Brain Bank and preserved as fresh frozen tissue).
Central breast subareolar region of the right breast, 1-2 cm under the skin surface of nipple region.
Cultured primary fibroblasts.
Transformed lymphocytes.
Ectocervix (squamous) from uterus. Bivalve uterus along the endocervical canal to open uterus and cervix from external os to fundus.
Endocervix (glandular) from uterus. Bivalve uterus along the endocervical canal to open uterus and cervix from external os to fundus.
Sigmoid colon, Obtain muscularis only; discard mucosa.
Transverse, Full thickness: mucosa and muscularis
Muscularis propria in the lowest portion of the esophagus just proximal to the stomach.
Squamous region (distal/lower third), at least 4 cm above gastroesophageal junction.
Squamous region (distal/lower third), at least 4 cm above gastroesophageal junction.
Left (and right if needed for sufficient aliquots) starting at, and to include, fimbriated end.
Right atrial appendage, tip (if fatty or discolored, take more proximally)
Anterior left ventricle, 1 cm above apex and 1 cm from left anterior descending coronary artery.
Left kidney cortex.
Left kidney medulla adjacent to Cortex.
Central right lobe, 1 cm below capsule.
Inferior segment of left upper lobe, 1 cm below the pleural surface.
Inner surface of lower lip.
The gastrocnemius muscle, 2 cm below the patella.
Left tibial. Peripheral tibial nerve from gastrocnemius region
Most normal regions of the left ovary (and right if necessary to obtain sufficient aliquots).
Mid-portion (not tail).
Entire pituitary gland.
Non-nodular region of representative region.
Extension of the abdominal incision to the suprapubic area avoiding pubic hair.
Left or right leg 2 cm below patella on medial side.
Thickened mucosa corresponding to lymphoid nodules (Peyer Patches) just proximal to the ileocecal valve in the most distal part of the small intestine.
Central region, 5 mm below capsule.
Body (Gently rinse mucosa with normal saline before aliquot preparation)
Left testis (and right testis if necessary to obtain sufficient tissue for aliquots).
Most grossly non-nodular normal regions from either side (whichever side is observed to be more normal).
Corpus. Bivalve uterus along endocervical canal to fundus.
Anterior.
Femoral vein; subclavian vein and heart are other possible sites.
